website_summaries.verdict: It might not look quite right, but the PowerShot D10 is a solid entry into rugged cameras for Canon.
pros: comfortable to use in water or with gloves
cons: Poor design for an everyday camera, expensive for an occasional camera

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camera. It's 5.5 years old and still going strong. I've had it in springs, pools, oceans, sand, mud, snow... I've dropped it, squashed it, crammed it into my purse with keys and stuff crashing into it, still looks like new. I've taken it horseback riding, parasailing, snorkeling, and let my kids play with it :) But probably the BEST testament for this camera is that I purchased one for my mother in law the Christmas before I bought mine, and hers is still going strong too. I love my MIL, but until I got the D10 for her, she managed to break every camera I gave her. Solid product :)
customer_reviews.author: Mos

customer_reviews.title: It always does a good job with underwater photos
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camera for years now. I bought it to do a photo shoot underwater when I was pregnant. I had it for almost 7 years now. We are a very active family in the water during the summer. It always does a good job with underwater photos, That is if the water is clear. But that has nothing to do with camera. One of the best things that I love about this Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital camera is the wrist strap. It is perfect to be able to swim with and not worrying about holding on to it the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Alleykat13161

customer_reviews.title: ... have bought this camera twice because it is so awesome. I had the first one 5 years and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this camera twice because it is so awesome. I had the first one 5 years and it still works but a little slow . It takes awesome pictures and it takes a lot of abusive...I go to the beach a lot and climb over rocks and such. My son bought this camera first and i liked his for I bought my first omne and now on mt second. My son is planning to get another one as well. He mountain bikes and was pretty rough on his and great camera.
customer_reviews.author: lilmiss

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend. We had been breaking a powershot camera at a rate of about 1 every six months. They jumble around in her purse, get dropped, wet, dirty, and its not long till they die. Not this bad boy. It doesn't have the best sensor or autofocus available today, but at least it works and takes sharp pictures after trips to the beach, being dropped a dozen times, getting caught in the rain, or having drinks spilled on it. HIGHLY recommended camera for kids, or reckless adults. There is a reason they've been making this camera for like 5 years, while all the other models change with the moons. IT'S A TANK!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Champlin

customer_reviews.title: Lens error is common, and not under warrenty
customer_reviews.text: The camera was great for almost a year. Took it kayaking a few times and on a few hikes. Had it packed away for about 4 months, took it out to find the dreaded "lens error, restart camera". After some research this is the old e18 error the camera used to get. Sadly, even with a lot of people who seem to get it, and even pc world doing an article about it, canon refuses to do anything about it. I know have a $250+ paperweight. Will not buy another canon again. I may return the one I just bought for a friend for Christmas and get him a different one. Wish I would have known about this last year.
customer_reviews.author: J. Connors

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera 2 days before we left for Hawaii and as stated in shipping details, it arrived the next day. We took 3000+ pictures with our new camera and the only ones that weren't all that great were ones that someone took accidentally ... floorboard of the car and stuff like that! The waterproof factor is excellent. As suggested in the accompanying manual, I soaked the camera for a couple of hours every night after using in salt water/sand conditions. About a third of the pics are underwater in the ocean. Yep, I am very pleased with the camera. Grateful to Amazon for getting it here in time for the trip!
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: love my photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera right before we went to Disney World as I didn't want to chance taking my Rebel. I am so happy I chose to purchase this camera!! I used it outside, inside, for fireworks, underwater, on water rides, at the aquarium and I have to say it performed past my expectations!!!! The picture quality was great! This camera also seems to be very durable. I will admit, I've already dropped it twice and the camera has had no issues, it still works perfectly! I would highly recommend this camera to anyone!! But I would also suggest in getting an extra battery, especially if you are going to be using it all day.
customer_reviews.author: Onemomonewoman

customer_reviews.title: Bye good little buddy
customer_reviews.text: ITs been 5 years since I purchased and have had no issues with it. Pictures great , used many times underwater till yesterday !!! Used it at the beach and now its stuck on one setting. So while it still works I cant zoom in/out and use all the other options. I do admit to being hard on it so I'm very happy with what its given me so far. I can still use in the water so will make do with one shooting mode till it totally kicks the bucket. Actually the longest lasting Canon I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Luckydwg

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I would purchase a different camera. I went with Canon because they are THE camera people. However, the camera started failing shortly after I purchased it. It started getting these "lens error" messages and at first I thought nothing of it. Over time, it got more and more frequent. The battery life is horrible, I went through two fully charged battery in about a day. I am not saying Canon is bad, just this specific camera. I sent it back to canon and they fixed the issue and sent it back to me. I took it on vacation and once again I got the "lens error" again. Maybe this camera is not meant to be used in the desert?
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: More than just a waterproof camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera very soon after its release. This should also be advertised as a purse proof camera. I am never without it. The size is just right for me to carry around all the time. I initially bought it for my kids to take to the beach, but I've since used it for indoor events year round because it never fails to take the best flash pictures. I own a Digital Rebel Xti, a Powershot G2 (an oldie), and yet another Powershot model (can't remember the number). By far, this D10 gets used the most. I always complain about battery life to some degree, but this is no worse than any other and probably better than most.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Underwater Camera
customer_reviews.text: So far the pictures are great...there has been a few issues with the camera locking up when trying to zoom. The system calls to turn off the camera and reset...which doesn't work. If you leave it on and hit the side with your hand a few times that corrects the problem... Read the manual especially the options section. There are soooo many options on this camera it it pays to read the manual otherwise you will miss something that would really enhance your pictures. I haven't tired the camera underwater yet but I will and when I do...if I can make an addendum to the review I will.
customer_reviews.author: BE

customer_reviews.title: Almost five years later, this camera still reliably takes nice pictures in harsh conditions
customer_reviews.text: We've taken this camera rowboating in Lake Michigan, up Mount Fuji, down many rivers in kayaks and canoes, swimming in heavily chlorinated pools. It's been dropped, submerged in dirty lakes, frozen, and it still takes very nice pictures. It also takes good looking videos when submerged which is very neat. If I had to find a criticism, it'd be that the optical zoom is typical of the PowerShot line (mediocre).
customer_reviews.author: Nate Hartmann

customer_reviews.title: Amazing photos
customer_reviews.text: The camera arrived to me just a week before our honeymoon trip to the Maldives so i didn't get a chance to test it or play with it. I'm a semi pro photographer, or a serious amateur you may say, the camera options are easy to figure out (to know its options go check the product page on Canon website) the underwater photos with or without flash are amazing. It lacks behind a bit on night photography at open areas so dont count on this camera as you all-in-one if you have a special occasion. But all in all. It performed well over my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Ramahi

customer_reviews.title: Great Photo quality - used for snorkeling and scuba (up to 20 meters)
customer_reviews.text: Although tech info stated that maximum deep diving is 10 meters I used it twice on divings from 15 to 20 meters without any problems. VERY GOOD quality photos/videos, easy to use, easy to change modes underwater, great pictures and also great utilization out of water. I do recommend. Even if you want something for pictures on the beach, this is a resistant and great option. Some fantastic videos and pictures, great buy. Batteries are ok but when diving I recharged it every day. Noticed that energy consuption is a bit bigger than similar "no diving" machines.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos J. P. Vieira

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life, good image quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very durable camera that takes good underwater shots for relatively shallow water (i.e. snorkeling, swimming). It’s held up to several years of use so far.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera prior to going to Cozumel, Mexico in January of 2011. My husband was extremely pleased with the picture quality. He used it snorkeling in 10-30 feet, and got great shots! We were careful to follow the instructions to soak the camera after each use in tap water, and never had a problem. It also took great pictures on land. We own an Olympus E3 digital camera that we use for personal use, so we are somewhat picky on picture quality.....this little camera was awesome for the money. You will not be disappointed. Would definately recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: i don't usually write reviews but i'm so impressed with this camera i just had to this time. i looked long and hard to find the best for the money and couldn't have done better at any price. this thing takes great pics and the video is just as good. the clarity of even the bubbles underwater are perfect. as to it's size... i've carried it all day in my pocket of my jean shorts and never new it was there and the rounded shape just makes it easier yet to get in and outof my pocket. i don't know of anything else i could ask of a waterproof camera. great job Canon, thank you...
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Great, Relatively Inexpensive, Turns on Fast, No Lens Cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. It turns on nearly immediately and takes pictures quickly. I've used it underwater while snorkeling, and have taken it about 20ft deep with no problems. Underwater pictures totally blow away disposable cameras. Not tough to use, although other programs are better to unload pictures than the one Canon provides. If you're moving a lot while taking pictures, they can come out blurry. The reason this isn't a five star review is because there is simply a glass protective cover over the lens, and it's really easy to smudge. I dread the day it gets scratched.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Must have for vacations and children!
customer_reviews.text: Water Ride...no proplem, on the lake....don't worry, your child wants to take pictures....let them!!! I have used this camera, in the water, underwater, in the rain, at boy scout camp, on vacation, everywhere! I bought thefor it so when my son (11) wants to use it I don't have to worry about him dropping it and the camera ending up at the bottom of the lake. I will gave it to him and his friends to take pictures at camp and didn't worry about him dopping it because it's very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: take it out drinking, it can take the beating
customer_reviews.text: I live by the beach and have taken this camera out a few times and it's great. But the main reason why I bought this camera was because it had a large aperture at the time compared to impact resistant waterproof cameras and.... to replace my mom's camera that a drunk friend had slapped out of my hand and ruined! I have also used this camera in classrooms, and it's not a big deal if children hold it to take pictures. I have dropped it a few times myself.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: D10 - great until it leaked
customer_reviews.text: I used this on many action vacations, and regular travel, its such an easy camera to carry and use its captured a great many wonderful memories. My only mistake was finally taking it snorkelling in salt water for the first time in Tahiti in November 2011 - it leaked and the innards rusted in a heartbeat. Prior to this it suffered from old age and was getting the lens error message - though a good whack seemed to fix it. At its current price this camera is probably still worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Hitchings

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, shipping problem
customer_reviews.text: The camera is pretty much what I expected tho' I haven't really had a chance to play with it much and have not had it near the water yet. It is a bit more complicated than expected and not very intuitive (at least to me!) but with all of its features, that's okay. My only problem was the shipping. I paid the extra money for expedited shipping as I needed it for a certain date but it was shipped ground anyway. The company, Electronics Expo, was very nice about refunding the difference but it didn't change the fact that I didn't have the camera on-time.
customer_reviews.author: PJP

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best cameras I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: It has been with us for about 7 years, and so far we have experienced zero problems with it. Great pictures and great videos and submersible up to 30 feet. We use it a lot underwater and so far it has been flawless (mostly saltwater). Of course, we always followed the maker's protocol to open it up after being submerged. It has performed so well, that we postponed the purchase of a Hero3.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Elosegui

customer_reviews.title: Worked for just over a year, then leaked water
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camera for the first year I owned it. I will always own a "tough" camera from now on. I never had to worry about it accidentally getting wet or dropped. That said, I did not abuse this camera, but after about a year of use it started acting up. After the first "episode" it began working again for about a month more. Then I could actually see that water had leaked behind the LCD and since then it hasn't turned on. I like Cannon, but I'm thinking about buying the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AFWife2002

customer_reviews.title: Best of the waterproof point and shoot cameras
customer_reviews.text: The Canon D10 has a view screen that works in bright daylight conditions. This allows the photographer to compose a picture. The canon d10 camera takes the best images of the three waterproof cameras that I own. The pentax and olympus waterproof cameras take acceptable images but their view screens are not bright enough for use in bright daylight conditions. I will be selling the pentax and olympia waterproof cameras. If you take water shots or ski shots, I recommend the Canon D10.
customer_reviews.author: T. Trimmer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little nervous to put this in water. We just got back from our honeymoon in Tahiti, Moorea and Bora Bora where we put it in all kinds of water and depths and it worked perfectly! We have great images of sharks and stingrays. There are so many types of scene selections such as Sunset, Beach, Landscape, Kids and Pets, Aquarium, Indoor, Night and Underwater. They helped a lot with the different areas we went to. We even received a lot of compliments on the look of the camera itself. It's a great buy for the price and the quality of the photos.
customer_reviews.author: UGoOli

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: I liked the camera for the first year I had it until I tried to take it snorkeling. It leaked, although there is no visible problem with the O ring, etc. As a result it turned off, can't be turned back on, and I'm being asked to spend $160 by Canon to fix it. I've used Sony underwater housings on diving trips for years and never had a problem. A camera that is marketed the way Canon markets this one shouldn't leak the first time it is dipped in shallow water.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: It's held up incredibly so far and the pictures it takes are very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a starter camera for a seven-year-old. I did my research and settled on this one, even though it wasn't necessarily the newest model available. It's held up incredibly so far and the pictures it takes are very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great all around point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to take with me on a snorkeling trip to Mexico. It works very well and I only wish it shot in RAW so that I can adjust the white balance afterward. Other than that it performs very well. Underwater photography is tricky, but this camera gives one anything needed to take a shot as well as movies. Very reasonable pricing for a point and shoot that is waterproof and shock resistant. I normally shoot with a 1D Mark III and an underwater housing for the camera cost more than the camera body!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kitaoka

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes wonderful pictures and I LOVE it. Unfortunately the battery door seal is of a poor design and leaks. I purchased this camera and within the first month, perhaps my second time in the water, it leaked. I sent it to Canon and they replaced it free :-) The second time I took it into the water the new camera leaked. I am sending it back to Canon, again. Love the pictures, love the features, but non of that matters if it leaks every time I take it into the water.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was hesitant to purchase this camera because of the bad reviews on the shape and size of the camera. I have to say I'm glad I went ahead and purchased it. By far, it has the best features compared to all other waterproof cameras. I'm not in love with the shape of the camera (it's submarine looking)however, I can't commplain when it comes to the functionalities and features. Overall, I am happy with this product. I bought it specifically for my trip to Jamaica and I was quite pleased with its performance. I would however recommend that you buy one of those plastic covers to protect the screen. I already scratched mine =(.
customer_reviews.author: Jophie

customer_reviews.title: Canon 1st Gen Underwater Camera a Gem
customer_reviews.text: Used the camera while snorkeling in both Honduras and Belize. When there is adequate natural light allowing the automatic underwater setting to select a shutter speed fast enough to freeze action you will be very happy with the results. The camera provided plenty of great underwater shots of the barrier reef in Belize as well lots of high quality shots on dry land as well. The camera stayed water tight and we had no issues or problems. Good value at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: LBMusicMan

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for years as an underwater camera to take on vacation. I just love it. It is takes good pictures. It is compact enough to hold when swimming and very durable. Just love it.
customer_reviews.author: VTangus

customer_reviews.title: CANON poweshot D10 12.1MP waterproof digital camera
customer_reviews.text: purchased this camera as a birthday gift for my boyfriend,,,,,he is in the ocean everyday and it seemed the perfect fit for him...after a month of normal use, it has stopped working properly and has become a frustrating situation...we have contacted CANON and they are suggesting we send it to them,,,,it will take some time to work on and the tech guy said they have been having problems with this camera...so, it was at first a wonderful tool for his ocean activities, but now it is useless...bummer.
customer_reviews.author: elli girl

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures, underwater and out. Canon did a great job with this one. I used it at a kid's birthday party and one of his favorite gifts was a water gun. He kept spraying everyone whether they wanted him to or not. I had him spray me while I took his picture and it turned out incredible! How many other cameras would you encourage a child to shoot a water gun at? I have played with all of the different settings and have really been impressed with the way the pictures turn out. I am looking forward to taking this camera diving in a few weeks! Definitely recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-purpose camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera, thinking I would use it for some diving and snorkeling vacations that we were taking, and wanted to capture great underwater memories. Wow! is all I can say, not only does it take great shots underwater... the quality of regular above water shots is also excellent. If you are looking for something that is perfect for Land and Sea - this is a great option! Pictures are of high quality, it is easy to use, menus are simple to navigate and have tons of options.
customer_reviews.author: Brad J

customer_reviews.title: Best camera for an active family!
customer_reviews.text: Best camera ever! Great for families with kids. Take it to the pool and beach with no worries!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small camera to take with me on vacation. I chose the power shot camera because of its features. I will be fly fishing, thus wading in water or in a boat on a lake and wanted one that was waterproof. I have used the camera and found it to be easy to operate and easy to carry with you. In fact, my 3 year old granddaughter has operated the camera and has taken very good pictures with it. This alone should attest to its ease of use. Great little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Mcintosh

customer_reviews.title: tested!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has really been tested by my wife and I, after 7 years still works. We have taken to Australia, I dropped it 20ft in the ocean in the Caribbean, we even took it on a mud run. Great pictures and some were better than my $2000 dslr. I will probably get a new one eventually or just by another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jorgy21

customer_reviews.title: This camera is NOT waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Although I loved the picture quality, my camera died after less than a year of use. I was shooting on a catamaran in Hawaii when a huge splash of water came over the top of me. The housing of the camera was properly closed, but somehow, the water entered the camera and the sccreen went black. The camera has not worked since. I called Canon and they said that since I had had it more than a year, they woud do nothing. I am looking at a Sony Cybershot TX10 or a Panasonic Lumix TS3.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki  Michel

customer_reviews.title: Great Photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these two years and it took great photos. Unfortunately, it was stolen in July 2011. I ordered another, even though it has several new competitors. The new D10 still takes great photos and they've added image stabilization. It's also miserly with battery power - I mean the battery lasts a long time. It still doesn't have HD video, but that's a small sacrifice. It is, as they claim, waterproof and dustproof.
customer_reviews.author: rbgilbert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Option
customer_reviews.text: I needed a waterproof camera. Afraid of buying just the case for my older camera, I bought this one after reading the reviews. It was an excellent purchase. It has been working just fine under the water and specially outside the water. Does it have some inconveniences? Yes. There is no action mode, the camera is a bit large to put inside the pocket, and there is no cover for the lens. Apart from those, excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: Weiser

customer_reviews.title: Camera Failed.  Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for rigorous outdoor use. However, it failed on me during our not so rigorous trip to China right after I bought it. I got an error message that would not clear. In the end I concluded that the problem was related to the mechanics of the lense or motor that would zoom it in and out. I was able to get it to work again by careful tapping that seemed to free up the lense. Bottom line, I returned it and Amazon was cooperative and then purchased a waterproof Panasonic that I am as delighted with as I was disappointed with this unit, Form factor of Panasonic is superior as well and far far less bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Cuica Maracas

customer_reviews.title: Best pre-trip purchase EVER!
customer_reviews.text: We're SO glad we bought this camera prior to our trip to Fiji. It was so fun to play around with, has an amazing lens capable of depth of field shots, takes some great underwater photos, and includes lots of features I would never have expected in such a compact camera (like manual focus and spot color). It's also really good at detecting faces - it even detected the face of the woman on the Fijian dollar! We loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Incredible underwater camera, decent above-water too.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this camera at first, but after taking it to Jamaica and snorkeling with it for three days, it is worth every penny. It is a little less flexible than the S series and it is harder to get good indoor shots with this camera, but underwater, poolside or outdoors it is outstanding. I couldn't be happier with the results. While it is a VERY GOOD underwater camera, I wouldn't expect it to be your everyday camera.
customer_reviews.author: Tom SteeleTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera so far......it's good for what it is, especially at this price. I've used it for snorkeling and shallow diving and it hasn't skipped a beat. I bought a silicone jacket for it too so it won't get beat up and scratched.
customer_reviews.author: 70's Collector

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera I Ever Owned!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for a long time now and have dropped it in snow, on the ground, took pictures underwater, and it has had ZERO problems and takes beautiful pictures. The only downside is that it is kinda bulky, but the activities I enjoy taking it on are where I have a lot of pockets or storage so it's not an issue unless I want to take it sightseeing or while wearing casual clothes and then you notice how bulky it is. This was the best waterproof camera on the market and you won't go wrong in buying this!
customer_reviews.author: David Greggo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Extremely good. I am still using it. It has been already 5+ years, still working smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Kranthi Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera! I love the images, ease of use, and video! The only thing I would change is making it a bit smaller and better images in very dark light. I took this to my Mexico trip and loved it in the ocean, pool, and on the jetski! I also took it skiing and tubing, the video and pictures all turned out excellent and it is very durable!!!!!! Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: A. DOBRSKI

customer_reviews.title: Many hours in the water
customer_reviews.text: I have been through many underwater cameras including those with housing. This by far is the simplest and provides the best pictures. 10 feet is the limitation of many cameras keeping you close to the surface. Deeper than 33 doesn't provide enough light for good pictures. This camera lets you go right where you need to be. Buttons are easy to push, start up time and shooting happen plenty fast. I had many 4 to 6 hour days in the water and the camera performed flawlessly. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Scheller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was little concerned buying something like this off the internet. I always like to take a look at it but I was pleasntly surprised. We live in Japan and we go snorkeling a lot. It was surprising easy to use underwater and fast to. There wasn't a delay once you pressed the button to take a picture. It's got all kinds of settings so it's easy to get a good picture underwater or wherever you are.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were a little nervous using the camera for the first time on our honeymoon but we walked away with a great camera and LOTS of beautiful underwater videos/pictures. The camera worked great underwater, was easy to use, and never leaked once! The picture and video quality turned out great. Many of our friends comment on the quality of underwater pictures we took. We followed the instruction manual on how to care for the camera after a day at the beach and never had any leak problems. Thanks to Canon for making an affordable and great quality underwater camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sahm

customer_reviews.title: Super waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was exactly what I was looking for--namely a rugged camera that I could take on a boat or to the beach, take those "once in a lifetime" pictures, and could be easilly toted along. The picture quality is excellent, as long as you remember to wait while pressing the button down halfway in order to let the camera focus. If you don't do this everytime, about only half of the pictures will be in focus. Its other weakness is that it is a little bigger and bulkyer then my previous PowerShot camera. But if you remember these points, the camera will let you get those priceless shots during your big adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Epic FAIL
customer_reviews.text: Bought this despite all the reviews about a fatal lens error and water leaking into the camera. Take my word for it, HEED those reviews. This camera failed the first time in the water, and it was in less than 3 ft. of water. I am miserably disappointed in this product, as I've had it all of 2 days and am already having to send it back to Canon for a replacement. I only hope they do the right thing and send me a brand new camera and not some refurbished camera. Seriously folks, don't put your photos at risk with this camera. An utter and complete disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Dyana Clement

customer_reviews.title: Trip to the Islands
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for a trip, it was fantastic. Got awesome pictures of sea-turtles while snorkling. Very good pictures of wife on the beach. Good all around camera. The lanyards is a little funky because you can move it around, but it actually comes in VERY handy. Since you probably want to strap it to something, like your wrist or life vest, and you can move the lanyard so it doesn't get in the way. All around a good camera.
customer_reviews.author: N. Clark

customer_reviews.title: very tough camera
customer_reviews.text: canon is canon. the picture qualities are great. add that up with waterproof feature and you are worry free when you are going to the beach or going to water activities with family and friends. It is also child proof as it can survive bumps and drops from the hands of my 2 year old daughter. Very good camera. it is just too bulky to hold though and expensive.
customer_reviews.author: rommel

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Underwater Camera
customer_reviews.text: We used these snorkeling in the Caribbean and got some great pictures as a result. So much better than the underwater disposables we used previously. You'll get better pictures out of a much higher prices camera, but for this price range they worked well above expectations. We also take these when we don't want to risk our new Rebel and got some great shots from them was well.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Canon waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. Took great pictures in the Bahamas. Easy to use. My only complaint is the way the straps hook to the camera and also there is no protector for the lens. I had to order additional corner connectors at $17 a piece from Canon to use a neck strap. No problems with it being waterproof. I did follow directions to soak it after using in saltwater. The videos also came out great.
customer_reviews.author: B Mount

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Grand daughter's first DLSR and works great under water. An easy tote-around. Pleasant price and delivery!!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Martin

customer_reviews.title: ... the third one of these I've had - I love it and it is perfect for underwater videos of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the third one of these I've had - I love it and it is perfect for underwater videos of the kids! Pictures are great too - but the underwater photography is much better looking than the on land photography (believe it or not)! Great little camera!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Carter

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera until I lost it. Still hoping it turns up in the house somewhere. Used this for everything. Hiking, swimming, everyday use. It was our "beater camera". Never leaked, took great pictures. Been coast to coast with it.
customer_reviews.author: charles ball

customer_reviews.title: I am optimistic!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to find a camera exactly like I had before. I was very happy with my old camera and had it for years before it finally died. Thanks to Amazon, I found this camera, supposedly new when I purchased it. Unfortunately, after two weeks of having it , the camera stopped working. I contacted Canon and still had a problem with it but two days later it started working again. It's been fine for a few weeks now. I hope it lasts!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this camera for 3 years and had it through everything vacations, underwater, sand, snow, and kids dropping it. It takes great pictures and is tough. Going to upgrade to the new one. Hope it is as durable and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy R

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for Sand Storms, too!!
customer_reviews.text: I know this is sold as a waterproof camera. But, that's the tip of the proverbial iceburg. We were in the Atacama desert, in a terrific sand storm. In about ten seconds our G11 was grinding (literally) to a stop. This doesn't affect my view of the G11 ... a hurricane-force sandstorm is a bad environment for most any camera. But, the D10 was perfectly happy. We can get it wet, we can get it filthy. Just run it under the tap when we're done! It's become our new all-purpose pocket camera. We *love* it!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Arnott

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera For Travel
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a birthday present to myself a few years back. It has been to the Caribbean, to multiple CA beaches, HI, many pools, a color run, muddy environments, the rain, dropped by a toddler- still going strong! Have not had any issues with leaking or anything. **I am very good about rinsing it in fresh water if taken to the beach!**
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Takes great underwater pictures. No problems with leaking. My kids can use it too and I don't have to worry about them dropping it. It was nice to be able to walk out to the ocean or get in the pool to take photos and not worry about getting the camera wet. I suggest using the chums waterproof camera float for added safety. Won't replace an underwater case for a SLR, but great for underwater shots for casual user, summer vacations or just summers at the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Derby City

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating!
customer_reviews.text: We refer to this camera as the tank. It has been dropped, splashed and crashed more than I care to think about but it still works. I love this camera and would recommend it to anyone who wants a great durable point and shoot camera. My only complaint? I do wish it was a little smaller, I still wouldn't give mine up though.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: good camera, but poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: takes great pictures, and the utility of it being water resistant makes this a solid purchase. the battery life kind of sucks, though, so make sure you're bringing spares if you're going to be snapping pics all day. this is mainly because they're no view finder, and relies solely on the LCD screen.
customer_reviews.author: Big Trev

customer_reviews.title: Point and Shoot Underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot digital camera. Takes nice underwater photos. Takes nice dry land photos. The accessory pack is a great addition. You get a nice rubber (think wet suit material) case and a bit assortment of lanyards that you can use to attach the camera to your body or other equipment. The lanyards are great for snorkeling, hiking and skiing. My only complaint is with battery life. It is a little short. I got about 100 shots on the first few charges.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S. Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: 6 month later dead LCD scren
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. I would marry it if I could but alas my friends after our 6 month honeymoon of near perfect pictures the LCD screen is dead. No screen no viewfinder, no review, no menus etc. Make sure you get the extended warranty for this camera. I did not and I now have to hope the problem does not reappear after warranty repair. If so I am out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Conway

customer_reviews.title: Vendor sells defective equipment.
customer_reviews.text: This camera was not waterproof and after one submersion water penetrated the lens and created foggy images. Now I am stuck with this useless paper weight. I do not recommend buying this product from this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: casey burke dunn

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera prior to a cruise where I knew I would be visiting a lot of beaches. I have now had it for over a year and am still very happy with it. I have taken some really cool underwater pictures and was shock to see things swimming in the water that I didn't even know was there when the picture was taken. The picture quality is very good in and out of the water. It is easy to use. I am very happy with this buy. This is the perfect camera for us.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Nah, don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for two years with great results, and then it finally failed and filled with water. When I sent it back to Canon at my expense, for a repair evaluation, I was told that to repair it it would be 240.00 Shoot, I only paid 99.00 for the camera to begin with. I got rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Cultech

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot D10
customer_reviews.text: I have found this camera to take beautiful pictures, great videos, but is a little bulky. This camera has almost as many settings as many larger more expensive cameras. have not used it in water yet. will do so when I go to Florida this winter and snorkel. I am pleased with it so far as I am with my other Canon cameras.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: 66 ft deep
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go on a trip, worried about getting my "nice" camera wet. I took it SCUBA diving, I thought it might make the depth and if not I wasn't out that much money. This little guy went to 66 ft with me. Two separate dives all kinds of great shots, the others on the dive boat were fascinated. It also took great shots on land, at the beach in full sun and even overcast. It is oddly shaped, but not unbearably so. Easy to charge the battery and the functions are pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: CaptJeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews of assorted waterproof cameras, I decided to go with the Canon D10. So far I have been very happy with my choice. It has excellent clarity in and out of the water. The video also has great picture. Amazon had the best price and offered free shipping. I've been spoiled by internet purchases being shipped same day and being able to track them. That being said Amazon did ship when promised and it was the US Postal service that failed to show correct information so not Amazon's fault. I'm a bit nervous regarding some reviews that it didn't perform well in the ocean. I look forward to finding out in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Denni

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: overall, works great, resistant, I carry it when fishing so I can take underwater/wet shots of the fish. It takes very good pictures (NOT professional quality, but a good point and shoot that suits my not so techy needs). The only downside is its bulk - the "submarine" design is cool but not all that practical. A.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Bachelez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pictures
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for his birthday. We live on a small island and often go snorkeling. We used it the day we got it and we were both very pleased with how well it works. Even our children were able to take nice photos with it. We are now able to share with our family in the states the ocean life we get to see each time we go to the beach and snorkeling. The only thing I have to say that I don't like is how long it takes after you take a photo, to be able to take another one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera - for what I paid for it
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, it has worked extremely well for me. But why is it $599.99 now when I got it for $291 in 2011? None the less, the camera works great underwater and when getting wet. Easy to rinse off the salt water after beach days. It still works great 3 years after I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was perfect. We took it on a trip to Turks and Caicos - lots of snorkling - and tons of pictures in (and under) the water. It was great to have a camera that could get wet and not have to worry about it. It is a little bulky to fit into a pocket - but not too bad. The picture quality is outstanding, and the facial recognition is great. Very easy to use, great addition to our stuff to pack for vacation!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: best camera ever had
customer_reviews.text: This camera is for sure the best one we've ever owned. We have two small children who LOVE to take pictures and we have no worries with the strap they can adjust around their little wrists. They've even dropped it already (which is what busted our other camera) and there was no problem or disfunction to the camera. Underwater photos are incredible and there is no compromise with out-of-water shots either. We did a lot of research and heard this was the best one underwater camera around. Now we believe it. Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: wren

customer_reviews.title: Like it alot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera as a Christmas gift for my parents to use at there beach house. They are very happy with the pictures it takes. It has lots of nifty features, but the menu navigation is somewhat complex. It seems bulky compared to the olympus waterproof, but feels very nice in your hand. The movable lanyard is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sloane

customer_reviews.title: Construction Inspectors Friend
customer_reviews.text: using cameras on construction sites is usually a death sentence for the camera. The dust usually kills then in a few weeks. I have used the D10 for over five years with no problem, wide range of picuture sizes and video capability are all part of ongoing uses. The battery has never run out before the end of the day and the flash is also good enough for service in any place I have been, including inside sewer pipes and underground structures. great camera. It is a little bulky, but not so much as to make me think of changing.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Logue

customer_reviews.title: Great Underwater Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first underwater camera. So I decided to go for what everyone rated the best. This camera is totally worth its price. I love it. I use it above water as well. I have only used it in pools. So I'm looking forward to using it in the waters of the caribbean and virgin islands. The function I like is the color accent. You point the little box to whatever color you want to stand out in your black and white photo and wallah!! It's magic.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy, great pics!
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot. Nice not to have to worry about getting it wet or my 2-yr old son grabbing and dropping it. Took it to the beach the first day I had it and it took fantasticly clear and sharp underwater pics! Easy enough to use that my 8-year old niece loved playing with it too. Only downside is that it only has a 3x optical zoom, but this is not the camera to be using if your taking that kind of picture anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Katie O.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for our summer vacation in the US Virgin Islands. Besides our masks and fins, this was the most important item on the trip. Everyone wanted to use it. And we had so much fun taking pictures underwater, above water and around the water. The pictures were fantastic and the videos wonderful. I made a series of slide shows and movies from all the clips that really has memorialized our vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Kliman

customer_reviews.title: Finally a great waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for taking pictures in my recent Orlando trip, thinking on take it to the waterparks. I'm so very happy with tjis camera, pictures are just perfect, we took the camera inside all pools and played with it all day long. At the end of the day, we passed the pics and videos to my Ipad and had the best time.
customer_reviews.author: Estupinan Rodriguez Jose David

customer_reviews.title: Good All-Around Rough Weather/Water-Proof Camera
customer_reviews.text: Good featured camera that functions well in rain/wet environments as well as being rated for moderate full immersion (snorkeling, etc.). Very fast from turn on to being able to shoot. Zoom and wide angle functions well, but buttons are a bit small. My only criticism is that the display screen should have been slightly recessed (or protected by a small rim) to prevent scratches when the camera is rested on its back. Mine became slightly scratched after a couple of days use.
customer_reviews.author: OKRAY44

customer_reviews.title: Canon Waterproof Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon generally. The picture quality is great. After some use a bit of water got into the lens making pictures look misty. It's quite chunky- so not as portable as other slim cameras that can tuck into a purse or jeans pocket. There is no lens cap to protect the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Saeeda

customer_reviews.title: water proof is a must
customer_reviews.text: Pros: water proof, water proof, water proof! I took the camera out to the river this weekend and it was around my wrist the entire time. In and out of water, the adjustable strap kept it secure on my wrist. I've owned multiple canon's, so already knowing the functions was a pro for me. Cons: Photos are only ok, though they're much better than my Powershot SD 780 IS. The camera is pretty thick. I joked that it is my obese camera. Overall, I absolutely love it. One less star for the shape and photo quality.
customer_reviews.author: online shopperrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for underwater shooting. Reef tanks or just shallow scuba/snorkeling is no problem. Great macro feature also.
customer_reviews.author: Doug K215

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth Canon camera, and for the fifth time, I am impressed. I took this camera fishing on Memorial Day (2009) and took some nice pictures. I added three of those pictures to the product page. One was underwater. The underwater picture I took looks murky, but I was fishing in a freshwater pond. No flash - just sunlight. And yes - the camera really is waterproof. I stuck the entire camera under the surface of the water, snapped the picture, and it still works just fine. I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Safari Hood

customer_reviews.title: bad quality camera
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this camera for cruise trip so that kids can have fun. It works fine underwater, however the quality is bad. Use for one trip only at first 3 month, the camera stopped working and got lens error messenger. Sent back for warranty repair at my own costs and received "repaired" item back. In 3 months after repair during second use, got the same problem again. Called Canon warranty service and was told they will not replace the defected camera, but will keep repairing it till the warranty expires. Then I need to pay repair service from there. Not sure you have similar problem as mine. But be careful before you buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: snoringcat

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last Eight Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas 2010. Today is August 6th and the touch pad has gone defective. We have taken the best care of this camera because she loved it so much and it takes wonderful pictures but now that I'm looking to return it it's a nightmare because I can't even find an email to send a complaint to at Canon. Funny enough I was just boasting about this camera to a friend yesterday, saying it was expensive but worth it. Now I can just say it's like paying $40 per month for a camera!
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly and takes a beating
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a gift for my wife to use snorkeling. So far it has worked perfectly. It has not leaked at all and takes beautiful pictures. We have had the camera almost two years now and it still works as good as it did the day we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Marty B.

customer_reviews.title: Use these for work (bridge inspection - both above and ...
customer_reviews.text: Use these for work (bridge inspection - both above and below water). Company has about 20 of these, very durable and long lived, some are already 4-5 years old and going strong after a few thousand pictures. Only dead ones are from drops onto hard surfaces from 10'+.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot D10
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for active people or anyone who is just a little clumsy. It has all the regular features of a Canon PowerShot with the added advantage of being very sturdy! It is a little bulkier than other PowerShot models, but it's worth it to me to have a waterproof and shock resistant camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera - we use it as our every day camera
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great camera for us. It is a little bulky compared to some newer models, but we are very happy with our purchase. We've had our camera for 5 and a half years.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxsun

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera in April 2010. Works great in a swimming pool. First time snorkeling (April 2011) in salt water the LCD screen died. Returned to Canon and they replaced with a refurbished camera. Continued to work great in a swimming pool and out of the water. Second time using in salt water (August 2012) the LCD screen again died. The camera still worked, you just had no idea what you were taking a picture of. I returned the camera to Canon to they want to charge me $172.00 to repair. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mary C. Vandegrift

customer_reviews.title: love the look!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my father and we all love it! it's small and great to use under water.
customer_reviews.author: LuvLyGrl

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER


For those with a taste for adventure, there’s a camera as bold as the active life you lead. It’s the Canon PowerShot D10. Waterproof, freeze-proof and shockproof; it’s tough enough to take what you dish out. Plus it’s got all the high performance features you expect from a Canon digital camera. You’ve got 12.1 megapixels of resolution plus all of Canon’s powerful, state of the art imaging technologies so you can capture your epic experiences in breathtaking color and awesome detail. 

PowerShot D10 Highlights 

Take this camera anywhere: waterproof, cold resistant and shockproof
Life can take you almost anywhere. So Canon engineered a digital camera durable enough to go where you go and produce the kind of awe-inspiring images that will earn your respect. It’s the PowerShot D10 and it's no ordinary digital camera. This unique camera is waterproof down to 33 feet so you can take it scuba diving, snorkeling or surfing. It’s freeze proof and can withstand extremes of temperature from 14-104 degrees (F) so it’s also ideal for snowboarding, mountaineering and more. Plus, it’s shockproof to 4 feet, so when the going gets rough, the D10 will keep going strong.



Unique accessories available such as customized straps and interchangeable faceplates
You’re always up for any challenge. So Canon designed the PowerShot D10 with a selection of versatile accessories (sold separately) that enable you to outfit the camera to meet the requirements of your next adventure. The customized strap is a perfect choice for those who want to have their camera within easy reach, yet keep their hands free. The Canon faceplates let you distinctively mark the camera as belonging to you alone. The carabiner hook offers you a handy way to securely suspend the D10 from a belt, backpack or diving harness. 

A World of Advantages with Canon’s Technology 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor has evolved Face Detection Technology that tracks the faces of moving subjects and lets the shooter enter the frame seamlessly with the Face Detection Self-Timer. 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor 
Canon’s most advanced image processor, DIGIC 4, delivers evolved Face Detection Technology that keeps every face in every photo looking its very best. The technology finds and tracks the faces of moving subjects until you’re ready to shoot, then delivers perfect focus. In addition, exposure, flash and white balance are compensated, so that faces exhibit natural skin tones and backgrounds are properly exposed. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the advanced DIGIC 4 image processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

A Face Detection Self-Timer automatically detects an increase in the number of faces and makes the appropriate adjustments. For instance, to include the photographer’s face in a group shot, there’s no need to rush in. Just put the camera on a stand or tripod, specify Face Detection Self-Timer, and the camera will wait for the photographer’s face to get on-camera before it takes the shot. Motion Detection tracks moving subjects in a much larger range--allowing you to wait for the perfect shot without refocusing. 

Intelligent Contrast Correction
DIGIC 4 also makes possible the i-Contrast (Intelligent Contrast Correction) system, which controls the compensation level in pixel units to brighten dark areas while leaving bright areas unchanged for better images where the main subject is dark, and more natural transition. The PowerShot D10 can even use i-Contrast in playback mode to adjust images that were shot without the setting activated. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures.
1) Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken.
2) The PowerShot D10 can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback.
3) You can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Life doesn’t give you second chances to capture special times. That’s why the PowerShot D10 features ISO 1600 setting that reduces the effects of camera shake and sharpens subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. ISO can be expanded to 3200 when you select ISO 3200 Special Scene mode. 

12.1 megapixels, plus 3x optical zoom lens with Optical Image Stabilizer
With the PowerShot D10, dramatic, personal pictures have never been easier to shoot and share. This 12.1-megapixel camera lets you create impressively large photos of family and friends you’ll be proud to display. The high-resolution images taken by the D10 can be enlarged up to 13 x 19 inches. 

The PowerShot D10 has a 3x optical zoom that gives you the power to shoot distant subjects with razor-sharp precision and stunning lifelike color. 

The PowerShot D10 is equipped with Canon’s acclaimed Optical Image Stabilizer Technology that automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you’ll be proud to shoot and share. And Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer Technology is so convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 

Blink Detection
Nothing ruins a great picture more than having your subjects’ eyes closed. That’s why the PowerShot D10 is equipped with Blink Detection. If closed eyes are detected, a "blink warning" icon appears for 3 seconds, allowing you to retake the shot before your subject or subjects move on. Blink Detection provides you with extra assurance when capturing once-in-a-lifetime moments like planting the flag at the summit of the mountain. 

Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot D10 to Smart AUTO and you’re ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It’s a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you’re photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you’re getting dramatic, memorable images. 



Shooting Modes 
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 19 Shooting Modes including 16 Special Scene Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way 

What's in the Box

 * PowerShot D10 body 
 * Lithium-ion battery pack (NB-6L) 
 * Battery charger (CB-2LY) 
 * Wrist strap (WS-DC7) 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB interface cable (IFC-400PCU) 
 * AV cable (AVC-DC400)
feature_bullets: 12.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
Waterproof to 33 feet, cold resistant from 14-104 degrees (F) and shockproof up to 4 feet
DIGIC 4 Image Processor; evolved Face Detection Technology plus Face Detection Self-timer
Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars787 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
